value.name: Louisville mayor expresses frustration at slow pace of Breonna Taylor case, lays out police reform plans
value.description: It has been over four months since Breonna Taylor was gunned down in her apartment when three Louisville Metro police officers executed a no-knock warrant. As the days, weeks and months passed since Taylor's death,

value.name: Louisville police: Releasing records in Breonna Taylor case hurts impartial investigation
value.description: The Courier Journal sued Louisville police in May, demanding the release of the investigative file into the fatal police shooting of Breonna Taylor.

value.name: Armed Black Militia to Descend on Louisville Demanding Justice for Breonna Taylor
value.description: The group's leader, The Real Grandmaster Jay, said they have been left with "no choice" but to hold armed formations in Louisville.

video.name: Armed Black Militia to Descend on Louisville Demanding Justice for Breonna Taylor

value.name: Mayor calls for police reform in light of Breonna Taylor case
value.description: It has been over four months since Breonna Taylor was gunned down in her apartment when three Louisville Metro police officers executed a no-knock warrant. As the days, weeks and months passed since Taylor's death, her family posthumously celebrated her ...

value.name: 4 Louisville protesters began hunger strike over Breonna Taylor shooting
value.description: Ari Maybe, Amira Bryant, Vincent Gonzalez, and Tabin Ibershoff held a press conference on Sunday to launch their "Hunger Strikers for Breonna" campaign.

value.name: Louisville mayor frustrated with delay in Breonna Taylor case
value.description: Mayor Greg Fischer laid out his frustrations with the time it's taking to complete the Breonna Taylor investigation while outlining reforms he's making with the police department.

video.name: Louisville mayor frustrated with delay in Breonna Taylor case

value.name: Sparks focus on Breonna Taylor, social justice before opener
value.description: WNBA players are happy to use the long-awaited return of the basketball as a canvas for social justice issues, including the death of Breonna Taylor.

value.name: Sixers’ Tobias Harris continues to push message: “Justice for Breonna Taylor”
value.description: Brett Hanikson, Jonathan Mattingly and Myles Cosgrove need to be held accountable and we need justice for Breonna Taylor and I’ll continue to preach that message after every single game."

value.name: Louisville Mayor: 'I'm as frustrated as everybody' on the Breonna Taylor investigation
value.description: Louisville Mayor Greg Fischer joins Andrea Mitchell Reports to provide an update on the Breonna Taylor case and the investigations into the police officers involved in her death. “I’m as frustrated as everybody,

video.name: Louisville Mayor: 'I'm as frustrated as everybody' on the Breonna Taylor investigation

value.name: Houston Texans’ Kenny Stills arrested during Breonna Taylor protest in Louisville
value.description: The wide receiver faces a felony charge after joining protestors Tuesday night at the home of Kentucky attorney general Daniel Cameron. The protestors demanded action against the police officers who shot and killed Breonna Taylor in March.
